artists.name: Radiohead
artists.description: Radiohead are an English rock band formed in 1985 in Abingdon, celebrated for their experimental approach that helped define alternative rock and electronic art-rock in the 1990s and 2000s.

artists.name: Maria Jaume
artists.description: Maria Jaume is a Mallorcan singer-songwriter whose intimate Catalan indie-folk songs, beginning with her 2020 debut “Fins a maig no revisc,” explore vulnerability and island landscapes.

artists.name: Antònia Font
artists.description: Antònia Font are an indie-pop band from Mallorca, formed in 1997, known for quirky, space-themed Catalan lyrics and Mediterranean melodies; they reunited in 2021 after an eight-year hiatus.

artists.name: Phoebe Bridgers
artists.description: Phoebe Bridgers is an American indie folk-rock singer-songwriter from Los Angeles whose haunting vocals and candid storytelling on albums like “Stranger in the Alps” (2017) and “Punisher” (2020) have earned critical acclaim.

artists.name: Clairo
artists.description: Clairo (Claire Cottrill) is an American bedroom-pop artist who gained viral attention with “Pretty Girl” in 2017 and has since released the introspective albums “Immunity” (2019) and “Sling” (2021).

artists.name: Extremoduro
artists.description: Extremoduro are a Spanish rock band from Plasencia, founded in 1987, famed for raw guitar riffs and poetic, often gritty lyrics that became a soundtrack for generations.

artists.name: Manel
artists.description: Manel are a Barcelona indie-folk pop quartet formed in 2007, singing in Catalan with brass and string arrangements that weave humorous, literate storytelling.

artists.name: ABBA
artists.description: ABBA are a Swedish pop quartet formed in 1972 whose glittering harmonies and disco-pop hits like “Dancing Queen” made them global stars; they returned with the album “Voyage” in 2021.

artists.name: Catfish And The Bottlemen
artists.description: Catfish and the Bottlemen are a Welsh indie-rock band formed in Llandudno in 2007, delivering riff-driven, anthemic hits such as “Kathleen” and the platinum debut “The Balcony.”

artists.name: Amy Winehouse
artists.description: Amy Winehouse (1983-2011) was a British soul and jazz singer whose smoky contralto and confessional songwriting on “Back to Black” influenced a new wave of retro-soul.

artists.name: Twenty One Pilots
artists.description: Twenty One Pilots are an Ohio duo formed in 2009 who blend alt-rock, hip-hop and electronic styles, winning a Grammy for the hit “Stressed Out.”
